classFeature.name: Eidolon
entries: By studying the magic of the planes, coming into contact with an extraplanar entity, or other circumstances you have acquired the ability to call forth a magical entity called an Eidolon.
To summon your Eidolon, you have to spend 10 minutes performing a magical ritual. Upon completion, your Eidolon appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of you.

When the Eidolon drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. If your Eidolon is more than 1000 feet away from you or you die, it also disappears. You can also dismiss your Eidolon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
Your Eidolon can understand and speak all languages you speak. While it is on the same plane of existence as you, you can communicate with your Eidolon telepathically.

Additionally, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can see through your Eidolon's eyes and hear what it hears until you end the effect (no action required), gaining the benefits of any special senses that the Eidolon has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.
Your Eidolon acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn.

When you acquire this feature, you choose a template for your Eidolon that determines it's base statistics. Your options are: {@creature Aquatic Eidolon|Ishiir|aquatic}, {@creature Avian Eidolon|Ishiir|avian}, {@creature Biped Eidolon|Ishiir|biped}, {@creature Quadruped Eidolon|Ishiir|quadruped}, {@creature Serpentine Eidolon|Ishiir|serpentine}, and {@creature Tauric Eidolon|Ishiir|tauric}. Your Eidolon shares your mental ability scores and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} proficiencies.
Additionally, your Eidolon learns two skills of your choice.
If you have a bonus to spell save DC, you also apply this bonus to your Eidolon's {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}, damage rolls, and armor class.

classFeature.name: Evolution Feats
entries: In your study of planar lore, you have unearthed ways to augment your Eidolon, changing its form or otherwise imbuing it with new abilities.

You gain two evolution feats of your choice. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=ef|source=Ishiir} page. When you gain certain summoner levels, you gain additional evolution feats of your choice, as shown in the Evolution Feats column of the Summoner table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the evolution feats you know and replace it with another evolution feat that you could learn at that level.

If an evolution feat has prerequisites, you must meet them to learn it. You can learn the evolution feat at the same time that you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to use the magical essence of the planes to cast spells. The information below details how you use those rules with Summoner spells, which appear in the {@filter Summoner spell list|spells|class=summoner (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

entries.name: Cantrips.
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Summoner spell list|spells|class=summoner (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir|level=0}.

Whenever you gain a Summoner level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the {@filter Summoner spell list|spells|class=summoner (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir|level=0}.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Summoner features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 spells from the {@filter Summoner spell list|spells|class=summoner (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Summoner levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Summoner features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Summoner spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Summoner, your list of prepared spells can include five Summoner spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you gain a Summoner level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Summoner spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Intelligence or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting ability for your Summoner spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB} as a Spellcasting Focus for your Summoner spells.

classFeature.name: Scholar of the Extraplanar
entries: You gain expertise in {@skill Arcana} and two additional languages.

classFeature.name: Summoner Specialization
entries: You choose a specialization in the field of summoning and planar magic to focus on. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 14th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Your Eidolon can attack twice, instead of once, whenever it takes the {@action Attack} action on its turn.

classFeature.name: Summoner's Guardian
entries: Your improved connection with your Eidolon allows it to defend you more effectively. You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to command your Eidolon to take a guarding stance while it is within 5 feet of you.
The stance lasts until the start of your next turn. It ends early if your Eidolon is no longer within 5 feet of you or it is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.
While the stance is active, all {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} that target you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Infused Attacks
entries: Your Eidolon's Attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Summoner Specialization Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Summoner Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Summoner Specialization Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Summoner Specialization.

classFeature.name: Greater Infusion
entries: You add your Intelligence or Charisma modifier (your choice) to your Eidolon's damage rolls.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Summoner Specialization Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Summoner Specialization.

classFeature.name: Life Link
entries: You create magical bond between your lifeforce and that of your Eidolon. When you or your Eidolon take damage that would reduce you to 0 hitpoints, you are reduced 1 hitpoint instead and the other takes the remainder of the damage.
The link has no effect on features that outright kill you when you are reduced to 0 hitpoints, such as the {@spell disintegrate|Ishiir} spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Summoner Specialization Feature
entries: You gain one feature granted by your Summoner Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Twin Eidolon
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to assume the shape of your Eidolon, adopting its Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, armor class, and hitpoints, and all its features and evolution feats.
You also retain all of your skill and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the Eidolon.

You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them, provided that your new form is physically capable of doing so. You can't use any special senses you have (for example, {@sense darkvision}) unless your new form also has that sense.

When you transform, you choose whether your equipment falls to the ground, merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The DM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the form's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect in that state.
You can maintain this form up to 1 hour while concentrating (as if concentrating on a spell) and you cannot assume it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonded Spells
entries: If you cast a spell on yourself, you can choose to cast the spell on your Eidolon instead if you can see it within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Evolution Feat
entries: You learn an additional evolution feat for which you meet the prequisites.

subclassFeature.name: Empower Eidolon
entries: You learn how to spend your own magical reserves to empower your Eidolon's attacks. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can spend a spell slot if you can see your Eidolon within 60 feet of you. For 1 hour, you add {@dice 1d8} times the level of the spell slot expended to your Eidolon's damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner's Call
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to call your Eidolon to your side. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Transposition
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to switch positions with your Eidolon if you can see it.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Evolution Feat
entries: You learn an additional evolution feat for which you meet the prequisites.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Eidolon
entries: Your Eidolon becomes an absolutely monstrosity. A true thing of legend and terror. Your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity (your choice) and Constitution increase by 4. And its maximum for those scores is now 24.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Recovery
entries: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by drawning from the essence of the planes. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your summoner level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 3rd level or higher.
For example, if you're a 4th-level summoner, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots.
You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Focus
entries: You learn how to read the barriers between the planes, making it easier for you to draw forth more powerful creatures. You have a number of planar focus points equal to your summoner level.

When you expend a spell slot to cast a conjuration or necromancy spell to summon one or more creatures, you can spend a number of planar focus points up to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier (rounded down). You can treat the spell slot as a number of levels higher equal to the number of planar focus points spent.
You regain all planar focus points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Army of One
entries: You learn how to summon an ever-increasing number of creatures to your side. When you cast a conjuration or necromancy spell to summon a creature, you can choose to ignore the {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} limit on that spell. But if you do so, you reduce the spell's duration to 1 minute.
If you lose {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}, you lose it on all spells you're concentrating on.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner's Call
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to call your Eidolon to your side. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Transposition
entries: You can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to switch positions with your Eidolon if you can see it.

subclassFeature.name: Host Caller's Link
entries: When you use the Summoner's Call or Transposition class feature, you can target another creature you have summoned instead of your Eidolon.

subclassFeature.name: Throw Wide the Gates
entries: You can cast the {@spell Gate|Ishiir} spell without expending a spell slot and without a material component. You must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiosis
entries: You learn to meld with your Eidolon's essence, two creatures merged as one, fighting in perfect unison.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, when you are within 5 feet of your Eidolon, you can merge forms with it, entering Symbiosis. The resulting form can be that of your Eidolon, your own, or something in-between.

In this form, you gain all your Eidolon's features and evolution feats, and you choose whether to use your own or your Eidolon's stats for each ability score and armor class. You gain your Eidolon's hitpoints as temporary hitpoints. All features and effects that normally affect your Eidolon's hitpoints affect these temporary hitpoints as well. If these temporary hitpoints reach 0, your Eidolon disappears and you lose the benefits of Symbiosis and revert to your normal form. You can also relinquish the Symbiosis and split up into a summoner and Eidolon as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.
You also retain all of your skill and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the Eidolon.
You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them. And you can use any special senses available to your Eidolon and you.

When you transform, you choose whether your equipment merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The DM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the form's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must merge into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect in that state.

While in this form, you can cast all summoner spells as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. Summoner class features that normally require you to be separate entities to work, allow you to target a different beneficiary instead, treating it as the summoner. In the case of Twin Eidolon, you instead completely duplicate your merged form for the duration and it receives all benefits from equipment that you are wearing and currently using in that form as well.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Defense
entries: When you are in Symbiosis, you can gain a bonus to your AC and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Reflexes
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and you gain a second {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Step
entries: You can cast {@spell Dimension Door|Ishiir} without a verbal component. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Two Minds, One Body
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} while you are in Symbiosis.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Coordination
entries: You can take an additional action and {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} or you spend a spell slot of 4th level or higher to use it again.
